means: 使成为徒劳，使变得无用( stultify的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Only a uniformed guard stultified with boredom might have overheard them.
sentence.Network_cn: 只有一名穿制服的无聊警卫可能偷听到了他们的谈话。

sentence.Network_en: Their unhelpfulness has stultified our efforts to improve things.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们不管事,我们为改进工作的用心也就白费了.
他当时一听,吓傻了, 气坏了, 瘫痪了.

list.abs: Others find the hierarchy stultifying ., 其他人则觉得组织单调乏味.
“红宝书”补充词汇（２） ... strut n. 撑杆; 炫耀，大摇大摆地走 stultify v. 使显得愚蠢, 无价值 stygian a. 冥河的, 阴沉的.
stultification 愚笨stultify 显得愚笨stum 未发酵葡萄汁
2008年5月20日 -  单调沉闷的教学方法stultifying teaching method 提供辅导服务providing counselling services 暑期进修班summer refresher classes 智乐儿童游乐场协会Playright.

entry.tran: 使思维迟钝;使厌烦;使呆滞
entry.def: If something stultifies you, it makes you feel empty or dull in your mind, because it is so boring.

example.tran: 这种态度会扼杀科学的进步。

example.ex: Only a uniformed guard stultified with boredom might have overheard them.
example.tran: 只有一名穿制服的无聊警卫可能偷听到了他们的谈话。

auth_sentence.content: But it is stultified by hang-ups, principally about whether pure is really pure, and whether applied is really materialistic.
auth_sentence.res_content: But it is stultified by hang-ups, principally about whether pure is really pure, and whether applied is really materialistic.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But it is stultified by hang-ups, principally about whether pure is really pure, and whether applied is really materialistic.
